abstract: Justice Dept declines to challenge AT&T's proposed $48.5 billion takeover of DirectTV, and acquisition has also received conditional approval from Federal Communication Commission chairman Tom Wheeler.
lead_paragraph: The proposed approval order outlines conditions that would benefit consumers by increasing competition in the broadband market.

headline.main: AT&T’s Bid for DirecTV Advances With Conditional Approval Order by F.C.C. Chief
headline.print_headline: AT&T’s Bid for DirecTV Moves Forward

snippet: The proposed approval order outlines conditions that would benefit consumers by increasing competition in the broadband market.
